body:
### Patches 

- Make sure benchmark runs in the production mode.: a9ccf1e147f8ed737dd58f6a611e01562bb92bd1

### Patches

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @timneutkens, @oliviertassinari, @dstaley and @kpdecker for their help!

This release introduces styled-jsx plugins. Allowing you to use PostCSS, SASS, LESS or any other css pre-processor with styled-jsx. An example of how to integrate styled-jsx plugins with Next.js can be found [here](https://github.com/zeit/next.js/tree/master/examples/with-styled-jsx-plugins). More information on plugins can be found [here](https://github.com/zeit/styled-jsx/releases/tag/v2.1.0)

- Upgrade styled-jsx: #3101

Huge thanks to @yashha, @timneutkens and @kpdecker for their help!

- Warn and exit if React 15 used inside the project.: #3061

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @arunoda for their help!

name: Next.js 4.0 Stable
body:
Next.js 4 brings faster SSR performance and better support for [dynamic styles](https://github.com/zeit/styled-jsx#dynamic-styles).

### Major Changes

* React 16 support: #2996 (faster SSR and React Fiber)
   _Due to changes in React 16, React 15 support was dropped._
* Styled JSX [2.0 support](https://github.com/zeit/styled-jsx/releases/tag/v2.0.0) (dynamic styles, production optimizations and many improvements)

### Minor Changes

* Treat navigation to empty hash as hash navigate: #2971
* Pass conf to export function: #2962
* Keep some buffered pages, that won't be disposed. Fix #1939: #2592
* Add webpack-bundle-size-analyzer example: #3013
* Add doc to onDemandEntries configuration: #3030
* Update with-firebase-hosting.: #3032
* Allow use of filenames in exportPathMap: #2973 
* Configurable opts for babel-preset-env + babel-plugin-transform-runtime: #2991

### Patches

* Fix typo in README: #3038
* Update the hash-statics example to support sub-dirs: #3015
* Example: Improve ReasonML example: #3021
* Added Fastify example: #3034
* More elegant application of antd: #2840
* Upgrade dependencies: #2998
* Corrected dependencies for preact and inferno: #2583
* Fix coding style of snippets: #2806
* Tie page visibility api to on demand pinger: #2818
* Only use strict dependencies: #2929
* Fix error messages in server/export.js: #2933
* Expose buildId to custom webpack configs: #3001
* Added PropType: #3003
* Add "asPath" information to url objects: #2988

### Credits

Huge thanks to @giuseppeg, @timneutkens, @kjs3, @kpdecker, @starriv, @Tom910, @sergiodxa, @brikou, @davidnguyen179, @micwehrle, @marciovsena, @Shalzz, @srigi, @estrada9166, @christianalfoni, @mineiro, @marbemac, @slaskis, @gwn, @ryanponce, @toolmantim, @nrako, @idkjs, @vorillaz, @craig-mulligan, @AugustinLF, @jthegedus, @jesseditson and  @tmcw

### Minor Changes 

- Update styled-jsx into 2.0.1-beta.5: #3052

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @giuseppeg for their help!

### Minor Changes 

- Configurable opts for babel-preset-env + babel-plugin-transform-runtime: #2991
- Update styled-jsx into 2.0.1-beta.4: 1cca97cb5df4ddf63a9a3031d5ba89795c98bd15

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @tmcw for their help!

### Minor Changes 

- Add doc to onDemandEntries configuration: #3030
- Update with-firebase-hosting.: #3032
- Allow use of filenames in exportPathMap: #2973
- Upgrade styled-jsx@beta to latest version: #3045
- Use styled-jsx 2.0.1-beta.3: b6e7691978157218cdab32b41758772e5180c288

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @AugustinLF, @jthegedus, @jesseditson and @timneutkens for their help!

### Minor Changes 

- Add styled-jsx 2.0 beta support.: #3039

### Patches 

- Fix typo in README: #3038
- Update the hash-statics example to support sub-dirs: #3015
- Example: Improve ReasonML example: #3021
- Typo on line 7: #3031
- Added Fastify example: #3034

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @ryanponce, @arunoda, @toolmantim, @nrako, @idkjs and @vorillaz for their help!

### Minor Changes 

- Keep some buffered pages, that won't be disposed. Fix #1939: #2592
- Add webpack-bundle-size-analyzer example: #3013
- Use ReactDom.hydrate just for initial renderer.: #3012

### Major Changes 

- Support for React 16 (fiber) added: #2996

### Minor Changes 

- Treat navigation to empty hash as hash navigate: #2971
- Pass conf to export function: #2962

### Patches 

- More elegant application of antd: #2840
- Upgrade dependencies: #2998
- Corrected dependencies for preact and inferno: #2583
- Fix coding style of snippets: #2806
- Tie page visibility api to on demand pinger: #2818
- Only use strict dependencies: #2929
- Fix error messages in server/export.js: #2933
- Expose buildId to custom webpack configs: #3001
- Added <Link scroll> PropType: #3003
- Add "asPath" information to url objects: #2988

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @kjs3, @timneutkens, @kpdecker, @starriv, @Tom910, @sergiodxa, @brikou, @davidnguyen179, @micwehrle, @marciovsena, @Shalzz, @srigi, @estrada9166, @christianalfoni, @mineiro, @marbemac, @slaskis, @gwn and @craig-mulligan for their help!

### Patches 

- Rename withRoute to withRouter to be consistent: #2881
- Use https to prevent mixed content when served over https: #2741
- Mark href propType as required: #2882
- Example: hashed statics: #2891
- Do not mutate browser source map object: #2900
- Docs(jest): add note about .babelrc: #2911
- Add missing variables: #2905

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @brikou, @sergiodxa, @kpdecker, @kentcdodds and @timneutkens for their help!

### Patches 

- Added side note about enabling gzip on Koa: #2867
- Example: with absolute imports: #2863
- Use buildId in chunk urls as well: #2873
  (Thanks @JulesAU @polovi  @marbemac for investigating the issue)

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @JulesAU @polovi  @marbemac @mmazzarolo, @sergiodxa and @arunoda for their help!

### Minor Changes 

- Add `withRouter` to create a HOC to get the router: #2870

### Patches 

- Add node trace source map handling in dev mode: #2816

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @HaNdTriX, @arunoda and @kpdecker for their help!

### Minor Changes 

- Pass an HOC to renderPage(): #2010
- Separate `next init`  (#2834): #531

### Patches 

- Next/dynamic Error Message Tweaks: #2798
- Fixed issue: #2804 
- Linked post about Next.js + Electron: 18e447afc50f44f70fb8a3c19b48eae885615ae1
- Updated console.log wording when the PageLoader is waiting for webpack to become idle.: #2835
- Make sure we do not expose stacktraces in production: #2843
- Clarify usage of `connect` in README.md: #2845
- Merge v3-beta into master: #2809
- Describe solution to centralized routing: #2844
- Downgrade `strip-ansi` to 3.0.1: #2860

### Changes in Example Apps

- Docs(material-ui): move the source code to Material-UI repository: #2808
- Simplify condition in mobx example: #2812
- Update example with emotion: #2837

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @jcheroske, @IanMitchell, @pencilcheck, @oliviertassinari, @brikou, @dustinsenos, @silvenon, @timneutkens, @mrwillis, @ldthorne and @jwillem for their help!

### Patches 

- Use _ as the divider for dynamic import name splitter.: #2793

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @arunoda for their help!

### Patches 

- Revert "Make the chunk name a bit pretty.": #2792

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @arunoda for their help!

This release is mainly because of #2788. That allows deterministic chunk names for dynamically imported modules. So, that prevents some related SSR issues.

### Patches 

- Use deterministic names for dynamic import: #2788
- Document SCSS/Less: #2742
- Add line-height rule for error page h2: #2761
- Clear missed interval: #2611

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @timneutkens, @sethmcleod, @NeXTs and @arunoda for their help!

### Patches 

- Remove beta information from the README.: a99a1670675d0de1fd9e43a6d63674b4370bf841

name: Correct version of Next.js 3
body:
We haven't published the correct version of Next.js 3 into NPM with the [launch](https://zeit.co/blog/next3).
This patch contains the correct version.

Update your app's `next` version to `3.0.2` or higher.

name: Next.js 3.0 Stable (3.0.1)
body:
Next.js `3.0.1` is comprised of all the `3.0.x` beta releases, and is equivalent to `3.0.1-beta.21`

For a summary of changes, check out: https://zeit.co/blog/next3

### Patches 

- Add a missing slash: #2634
- Minor grammatical fix: "resembling of" -> "similar to": #2669
- Make sure the /static working properly.: #2675

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @mocheng @cyrilf, @seldo and @arunoda for their help!

### Patches 

- Make sure /static/ and /_next/ are valid internal urls.: #2631

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @vanniewelt, @timneutkens @arunoda for their help!

### Patches 

- Add with-emotion example: #2395
- Component display name fixes for Apollo examples: #2211
- Better data fetching error handling for Apollo examples: #2227
- Allow cleaning from non-cwd: #2451
- Update emotion examples with new API for SSR and React endpoint: #2456
- Fix regex for pages that end with index: #2505

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @mitchellhamilton, @jaydenseric, @rgbkrk, @hamlim and @fridays for their help!

### Patches 

- Document usage of `<Link>` without `<a>`: #2369
- Make it easy and meaningful to analyze the bundle.: #2393

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @timneutkens and @arunoda for their help!

Fixes the HMR issue with styled-jsx [#2269](https://github.com/zeit/next.js/issues/2269).
The fix is done at https://github.com/zeit/styled-jsx/pull/236 by @akupila.

### Patches 

- Update styled-jsx to 1.0.6.: #2368
- [Stable] Move from Fly to Taskr: #2306

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @akupila, @giuseppeg, @lukeed and @arunoda for their help!

### Patches 

- Updates styled-jsx to fix issues and bugs: #2275

### Other Changes

- Remove hardcoded address from ws example.: #2204
- Add with-react-ga example: #2225

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @adrianleb, @vinaypuppal and @khrome83 for their help!

This patch release comes with XSS related security updates with some other minor bug fixes.
It's highly recommended to update your Next.js app to this release to prevent from a XSS attack identified by [ru_raz0r](https://twitter.com/ru_raz0r).

### Patches 

- Ignore chrome checksum on appveyor: #2176
- [WIP] Reload webpack if needed: #2076

### Credits 

Huge thanks to [ru_raz0r](https://twitter.com/ru_raz0r) for investigating the XSS related bug.

Fixes a few [HMR](https://webpack.js.org/concepts/hot-module-replacement/) related issues which affects the development flow of Next.js apps.

### Patches 

- Fix test failures: #2129
- Add link to example for webpack-bundle-analyzer  (#2104): #1130
- Fix HMR http request timeout issue under node 8. : #2166

### Credits 

Huge thanks to @arunoda for their help!

**This upgrade is *completely backwards compatible and recommended for all users***
**For future security related communications of our OSS projects, please [join this mailing list](http://eepurl.com/cQVY_5)**

We were notified of a directory traversal issue under the `/_next` and `/static` request namespace.
An attacker can craft a request that accesses potentially sensitive information in your filesystem.

tl;DR: the fix is live as a patch release and we're working together with a security firm to audit our OSS codebases routinely and avoid issues in the future.

## How to upgrade

- We have released patch versions of the stable and `beta` releases.
- The following versions fix this bug and include precautions to avoid
  similar problems in the future
  - `next@2.4.1`
  - `next@3.0.0-beta7`
- Run `npm install next@2.4.1 --save`

## Who is affected

- **Affected**: Users of Next.js prior to this release  
- **Not affected**: Deployments on https://now.sh (like https://zeit.co) are mitigated
- **Not affected**: Static deployments via `next export`

We recommend *everyone to upgrade regardless of whether you can reproduce the issue or not*.

Container-based deployments, `chroot` environments and virtualization users are at significantly less risk of sensitive data exposure. In most scenarios, an attacker would only be able to access frontend JavaScript components exclusively.

### How to assess impact

If you think sensitive code or data could have been exposed, please filter logs of affected sites by `..` (excluding quotes in all cases) and check for 200 responses.

## What is being done

As Next.js has grown in popularity, it has received the attention of security researchers and auditors. We are thankful to [@ru_raz0r](https://twitter.com/ru_raz0r) for his investigation and discovery of the original bug and subsequent responsible disclosure.

- We have notified large deployments of Next.js in advance of this publication.
- If you want to stay on top of our security related news impacting Next.js or other projects, please [join this mailing list](http://eepurl.com/cQVY_5).
- We are also very happy to announce that we're working together with [Lift Security](https://liftsecurity.io) / [Node Security](https://nodesecurity.io) on an audit of all our OSS projects in a recurring basis to ensure a safe experience for everyone.
- We encourage responsible disclosure of future issues. Please email us at **security@zeit.co**. We are actively monitoring this mailbox.

Improve error handling, HMR, Windows support (+CI tests)

## New

### Accessing parsed url in getInitialProps

`getInitialProps` receives `pathname` and `query` in the argument now (#62).

``` js
export default class extends React.Component {
  static getInitialProps ({ pathname, query }) {
    ...
  }
} 
```

You can use them on both server and client. No manual parsing needed!
